publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: Sicily and Naples, or, The fatall vnion : A tragoedy. By S.H. A.B è C. Ex
monogr.author: S. H. (Samuel Harding)

div.p: Reader. Before thou proceed'st farther, mend with thy pen these few escapes of the presse: The delight & pleasure I dare promise thee to finde in the whole, will largely make amends for thy paines in correcting some two or three syllables.

Pag. 1. l. 16. for in r. on. p. ib. l. 17. f. their's r. they'r. ib. l. 19. dele too. p. 2. l. 18. f. cold lazy r. cold and lazy. p. 4. l. 13. f. our d ••• ded r. our long divided. p. 8. l. 8. dele had. p. 9. l. 20. f. come r. came. p. 14. l. 25. dele (with musitians) p. 25. l. 34. f. these o're r. these are. p. ib. l. 35. f. you r. you. p. 27. l. 8. f. runne r. runne. out. p. 29. l. 11. f. thee, r. the. p. 33. l. 20. f. that joy r. those jo yes. p. 35. l. 25. f. whither r. wither. p. 37. l. 9. f. have r. leave. p. 38. l. 3. f. wild, r. wide. p. 60.3. f. auger r. anger. p. 85. l. 17. f. thinkes r. thankes. p. 91. f. forfeited r. surfeited.
